assigned.description: Validate how tariff pricing is currently calculated and surfaced in vendor promotions. Update SellSmart outputs to consistently include tariff‑adjusted pricing so sales reps have full cost visibility during customer conversations.

Review recent examples of context confusion in multi‑request conversations. Identify patterns where intent or scope is being lost and define expectations for conversation state persistence and follow‑up handling.

Audit current SellSmart responses to identify where NetSuite links are missing. Define clear criteria for when a NetSuite link is required and ensure consistent inclusion across all applicable result types.

Here's a recap of the suggestions from our last three sessions: Wallpaper vendors and their promotions Saved searches for vendor promos Lead times for upholstery and casegoods Insights from past sales reps Consider finding the most recent sales order for reference "Good, better, best" price points Vendors with specific products

Summary The issue involves changing the ticket assignment process for the CI team. Currently, tickets are assigned using skill-based matching in a round-robin fashion. Quintina wants to implement a "Dedicated Agent" field to ensure clients have a specific agent assigned to them. Context Quintina's clients prefer a consistent agent for their interactions. The new "Dedicated Agent" field will allow tickets to be assigned to a specific agent if one is designated in the client's Zendesk account. If no dedicated agent is assigned, tickets will continue to be distributed in a round-robin manner. Acceptance criteria Implement a new field called "Dedicated Agent" in the system. If a client has a dedicated agent, assign tickets to that agent. If no dedicated agent is specified, assign tickets using the round-robin method. Develop a clear plan and process to present to Leadership. Consider the need for a custom script to run hourly on the Task server. Other information N/A

SellSmart currently relies on manually uploaded CSVs (vendor contacts, extranet credentials, gallery advocate data, lead times), which require frequent updates and become stale quickly. We should explore long‑term automation options: (1)  replacing CSVs with a Boomi‑backed synchronous API for live vendor data from NetSuite, or (2)  building an automated service that periodically exports NetSuite saved searches / SuiteQL queries and refreshes the CSVs in Copilot. The goal is to eliminate manual updates and improve accuracy and maintainability.

Benchmark  faster-whisper  CPU models (tiny/base/small/medium) locally. Record transcription times for short/medium/long calls. Compare accuracy vs cost implications for future AWS deployment. Document initial findings to guide ECS sizing.

The SellSmart Update Review Meeting reinforced the importance of increasing visibility and maintaining a high level of trust in SellSmart by delivering transparent, dependable results.  Key themes included ensuring  NetSuite links are present on all applicable outputs  to support verification and confidence, addressing  context confusion in multi‑request conversations , and incorporating  tariff pricing into vendor promotions  so sales reps have complete pricing visibility at the point of use.  Additional focus areas included participating in  new‑hire training  to better understand real workflows and identify opportunities for SellSmart to provide meaningful assistance, as well as reviewing how  consignment vendor entries  are stored to prevent data ambiguity.  Overall, the discussion emphasized building a tool that integrates cleanly into daily workflows and can be relied upon without friction, confusion, or loss of trust.

Estimate cost ranges based on early performance tests and expected call volume. Identify cheapest viable Whisper model + Fargate configuration. Summarize findings for review with leadership (Choros, Josh). Recommend next steps (refine PoC, adjust architecture, or migrate pieces to AWS).

Outline a pipeline using API Gateway → Lambda → temporary‑S3 (auto-delete) → SQS → ECS Fargate Whisper worker → write‑back Lambda. Keep options open and note risks, assumptions, and unknowns. Identify what can be reused from the local PoC. Produce a short architectural sketch (non‑final).

Clone the CCS Dashboard and convert it to a dashboard for Case Initiators. Then send to Don Gibson for feedback. Some context: All Case iniatiors are tagged on their agent account with “ci” and “case_initiator__ci__”. The Custom role filter can just be set to CI Workflow for Customer service: Case Iniator takes call and creates ticket OR gets round robin a emailed ticket Decides the request, cause of issue, and first resolution Parent Ticket is the first ticket made for communication witht he client. Once finish being built it will be sent assigned to Quintina/Tiffany who will assign to a CCS for ALL future communications The child ticket that was created by the CI is by each vendor involed on the sales order This child ticket is what also generates the Case in Netsuite using the barcodes filled out by the CI Then that is assigned to micheal weimer who assigns to a Vendor Communication Specialist(VCS)  If there is any issues or missing information like photos for example it will be returned to the CI If escalated it will go to supervisor depending on role so CI=don gibson CCS=Quintina/Tiffany, and VCS= Micheal Weimer. ALL THESE NOTES ARE TO SAY NOT EVERY REPORT FOR THE CCS DASHBOARD MAY MAKE SENSE FOR CI SINCE HTEY USUALLY DONT KEEP THE TICKET ASSIGNED TO THEM User story As a Case Initiator, when I receive a call or an emailed ticket, I want to create a ticket so that I can manage the request and resolution effectively. As a Case Initiator, when I generate a child ticket, I want it to create a Case in Netsuite so that I can track vendor communications accurately. Context The issue involves cloning the CCS Dashboard to create a new dashboard specifically for Case Initiators. This dashboard will help Case Initiators manage their tickets and communications more effectively. Acceptance criteria Clone the CCS Dashboard for Case Initiators. Tag all Case Initiators on their agent accounts with “ci” and “case_initiator__ci__”. Set the Custom role filter to CI. Ensure the workflow for Customer Service is integrated: Case Initiators can create tickets from calls or emailed tickets. The first ticket must be the Parent Ticket for client communication. Child tickets must be generated for each vendor involved in the sales order. Child tickets should create Cases in NetSuite using barcodes filled out by the Case Initiator. Assign generated Cases to Michael Weimer, who will then assign them to a Vendor Communication Specialist (VCS). Handle any issues or missing information by returning tickets to the Case Initiator. Escalate cases to supervisors based on roles (CI to Don Gibson, CCS to Quintina/Tiffany, VCS to Michael Weimer). Adapt the dashboard to ensure that not all CCS Dashboard reports are relevant for Case Initiators. Other information Feedback on the dashboard should be sent to Don Gibson. CCS Dashboard Link

Summary Update the messaging used by the bot for customer interactions. This includes new responses for when a team member is unavailable and revisions to existing messages. Context Quintina has requested changes to the bot's messaging. The goal is to improve customer communication when team members are not available. Acceptance criteria Implement the following response if the bot states: “Thanks, I’ll connect you now. One of our team members will join the chat shortly.” If a customer waits more than 3 minutes without interaction from a live person, respond with: “Thanks for your patience! Unfortunately, it appears that a team member isn’t available to join the chat. I’ll be sure to pass your request along to the appropriate team member so they can assist you as soon as possible. Before I do, is there any additional information you’d like to share that may help us better assist you?” Ensure this messaging applies to all departments, including delivery and accounting. Update the current messaging to: “I’d be happy to check and see if a team member is available at this time. If so, they’ll join the chat shortly. Thank you for your patience while I work on this for you.” Other information N/A

assigned.summary: Stella Bot on front page during Off Hours
assigned.description: User story As a client, when I visit the main page after hours, I want to interact with the Stella bot so that I can get answers to my questions without waiting for a live agent. As a member of the Client Relations team, when I receive inquiries after hours, I want the Stella bot to handle Q&A so that I can focus on more complex issues during regular hours. Context Stella bot will be featured on the main page after hours to assist with inquiries. The Client Relations team, led by Quintina, usually manages live chat inquiries. During off-hours, the bot will provide answers based on provided documents. Acceptance criteria Identify questions the bot cannot currently answer using the provided documents. Create articles for questions that the bot cannot answer. Build flows for specific tasks, such as building a room. Ensure that questions leading to a ticket are directed to Case initiators. Clearly mark tickets for presales. Focus on deflecting ticket creation by answering FAQs and guiding users to the appropriate pages. Include quick options for pricing/suggestions and scheduling a visit. Remove the quick option for the website. Other information The Client Relations team has provided two documents: A list of inquiries they have received recently. A cheat sheet of questions, answers, and usual flow.

Summary A user inquired about finding forms for the trade account from their profile page. The bot incorrectly responded with the Account Details flow instead of providing navigation instructions. Context The issue arises when users seek specific information about their trade account. The bot's response does not align with the user's request, leading to confusion. Acceptance criteria The bot should provide clear instructions for navigating to the trade account forms from the profile page. The response should not redirect users to the Account Details flow when they ask about forms. Other information N/A

reported.description: Architecture Overview This is a Next.js 15 application with a modern React architecture focused on AI-powered product matching. The project uses: Core Framework & Structure Next.js App Router  (using the  app/  directory structure) TypeScript  for type safety Server-side rendering  with API routes for backend integration UI Framework & Styling shadcn/ui  component library (evident from components.json) Tailwind CSS  for styling Radix UI  primitives as the foundation (extensive usage in pnpm-lock.yaml) Lucide React  for icons Data & Search Integration Python backend integration  via API routes for embedding generation FAISS vector search  integration for similarity matching Real-time search engine  with both text and image search capabilities

all_unique.description: Validate how tariff pricing is currently calculated and surfaced in vendor promotions. Update SellSmart outputs to consistently include tariff‑adjusted pricing so sales reps have full cost visibility during customer conversations.

Review recent examples of context confusion in multi‑request conversations. Identify patterns where intent or scope is being lost and define expectations for conversation state persistence and follow‑up handling.

Here's a recap of the suggestions from our last three sessions: Wallpaper vendors and their promotions Saved searches for vendor promos Lead times for upholstery and casegoods Insights from past sales reps Consider finding the most recent sales order for reference "Good, better, best" price points Vendors with specific products

Summary The issue involves changing the ticket assignment process for the CI team. Currently, tickets are assigned using skill-based matching in a round-robin fashion. Quintina wants to implement a "Dedicated Agent" field to ensure clients have a specific agent assigned to them. Context Quintina's clients prefer a consistent agent for their interactions. The new "Dedicated Agent" field will allow tickets to be assigned to a specific agent if one is designated in the client's Zendesk account. If no dedicated agent is assigned, tickets will continue to be distributed in a round-robin manner. Acceptance criteria Implement a new field called "Dedicated Agent" in the system. If a client has a dedicated agent, assign tickets to that agent. If no dedicated agent is specified, assign tickets using the round-robin method. Develop a clear plan and process to present to Leadership. Consider the need for a custom script to run hourly on the Task server. Other information N/A

SellSmart currently relies on manually uploaded CSVs (vendor contacts, extranet credentials, gallery advocate data, lead times), which require frequent updates and become stale quickly. We should explore long‑term automation options: (1)  replacing CSVs with a Boomi‑backed synchronous API for live vendor data from NetSuite, or (2)  building an automated service that periodically exports NetSuite saved searches / SuiteQL queries and refreshes the CSVs in Copilot. The goal is to eliminate manual updates and improve accuracy and maintainability.

Benchmark  faster-whisper  CPU models (tiny/base/small/medium) locally. Record transcription times for short/medium/long calls. Compare accuracy vs cost implications for future AWS deployment. Document initial findings to guide ECS sizing.

The SellSmart Update Review Meeting reinforced the importance of increasing visibility and maintaining a high level of trust in SellSmart by delivering transparent, dependable results.  Key themes included ensuring  NetSuite links are present on all applicable outputs  to support verification and confidence, addressing  context confusion in multi‑request conversations , and incorporating  tariff pricing into vendor promotions  so sales reps have complete pricing visibility at the point of use.  Additional focus areas included participating in  new‑hire training  to better understand real workflows and identify opportunities for SellSmart to provide meaningful assistance, as well as reviewing how  consignment vendor entries  are stored to prevent data ambiguity.  Overall, the discussion emphasized building a tool that integrates cleanly into daily workflows and can be relied upon without friction, confusion, or loss of trust.

Estimate cost ranges based on early performance tests and expected call volume. Identify cheapest viable Whisper model + Fargate configuration. Summarize findings for review with leadership (Choros, Josh). Recommend next steps (refine PoC, adjust architecture, or migrate pieces to AWS).

Outline a pipeline using API Gateway → Lambda → temporary‑S3 (auto-delete) → SQS → ECS Fargate Whisper worker → write‑back Lambda. Keep options open and note risks, assumptions, and unknowns. Identify what can be reused from the local PoC. Produce a short architectural sketch (non‑final).

Clone the CCS Dashboard and convert it to a dashboard for Case Initiators. Then send to Don Gibson for feedback. Some context: All Case iniatiors are tagged on their agent account with “ci” and “case_initiator__ci__”. The Custom role filter can just be set to CI Workflow for Customer service: Case Iniator takes call and creates ticket OR gets round robin a emailed ticket Decides the request, cause of issue, and first resolution Parent Ticket is the first ticket made for communication witht he client. Once finish being built it will be sent assigned to Quintina/Tiffany who will assign to a CCS for ALL future communications The child ticket that was created by the CI is by each vendor involed on the sales order This child ticket is what also generates the Case in Netsuite using the barcodes filled out by the CI Then that is assigned to micheal weimer who assigns to a Vendor Communication Specialist(VCS)  If there is any issues or missing information like photos for example it will be returned to the CI If escalated it will go to supervisor depending on role so CI=don gibson CCS=Quintina/Tiffany, and VCS= Micheal Weimer. ALL THESE NOTES ARE TO SAY NOT EVERY REPORT FOR THE CCS DASHBOARD MAY MAKE SENSE FOR CI SINCE HTEY USUALLY DONT KEEP THE TICKET ASSIGNED TO THEM User story As a Case Initiator, when I receive a call or an emailed ticket, I want to create a ticket so that I can manage the request and resolution effectively. As a Case Initiator, when I generate a child ticket, I want it to create a Case in Netsuite so that I can track vendor communications accurately. Context The issue involves cloning the CCS Dashboard to create a new dashboard specifically for Case Initiators. This dashboard will help Case Initiators manage their tickets and communications more effectively. Acceptance criteria Clone the CCS Dashboard for Case Initiators. Tag all Case Initiators on their agent accounts with “ci” and “case_initiator__ci__”. Set the Custom role filter to CI. Ensure the workflow for Customer Service is integrated: Case Initiators can create tickets from calls or emailed tickets. The first ticket must be the Parent Ticket for client communication. Child tickets must be generated for each vendor involved in the sales order. Child tickets should create Cases in NetSuite using barcodes filled out by the Case Initiator. Assign generated Cases to Michael Weimer, who will then assign them to a Vendor Communication Specialist (VCS). Handle any issues or missing information by returning tickets to the Case Initiator. Escalate cases to supervisors based on roles (CI to Don Gibson, CCS to Quintina/Tiffany, VCS to Michael Weimer). Adapt the dashboard to ensure that not all CCS Dashboard reports are relevant for Case Initiators. Other information Feedback on the dashboard should be sent to Don Gibson. CCS Dashboard Link

Summary Update the messaging used by the bot for customer interactions. This includes new responses for when a team member is unavailable and revisions to existing messages. Context Quintina has requested changes to the bot's messaging. The goal is to improve customer communication when team members are not available. Acceptance criteria Implement the following response if the bot states: “Thanks, I’ll connect you now. One of our team members will join the chat shortly.” If a customer waits more than 3 minutes without interaction from a live person, respond with: “Thanks for your patience! Unfortunately, it appears that a team member isn’t available to join the chat. I’ll be sure to pass your request along to the appropriate team member so they can assist you as soon as possible. Before I do, is there any additional information you’d like to share that may help us better assist you?” Ensure this messaging applies to all departments, including delivery and accounting. Update the current messaging to: “I’d be happy to check and see if a team member is available at this time. If so, they’ll join the chat shortly. Thank you for your patience while I work on this for you.” Other information N/A

all_unique.summary: Stella Bot on front page during Off Hours
all_unique.description: User story As a client, when I visit the main page after hours, I want to interact with the Stella bot so that I can get answers to my questions without waiting for a live agent. As a member of the Client Relations team, when I receive inquiries after hours, I want the Stella bot to handle Q&A so that I can focus on more complex issues during regular hours. Context Stella bot will be featured on the main page after hours to assist with inquiries. The Client Relations team, led by Quintina, usually manages live chat inquiries. During off-hours, the bot will provide answers based on provided documents. Acceptance criteria Identify questions the bot cannot currently answer using the provided documents. Create articles for questions that the bot cannot answer. Build flows for specific tasks, such as building a room. Ensure that questions leading to a ticket are directed to Case initiators. Clearly mark tickets for presales. Focus on deflecting ticket creation by answering FAQs and guiding users to the appropriate pages. Include quick options for pricing/suggestions and scheduling a visit. Remove the quick option for the website. Other information The Client Relations team has provided two documents: A list of inquiries they have received recently. A cheat sheet of questions, answers, and usual flow.
